title: NDTV News-World-news
description: NDTV.com provides the latest information from and in-depth coverage of India and the world. Find breaking news, India news, top stories, elections, politics, business, cricket, movies, lifestyle, health, live TV, videos, photos and more.

entries.title: On Camera, 2 Planes Collide At Portugal Air Show, Pilot Dead: Report
entries.description: Two small planes collided midair Sunday during an air show performance in southern Portugal, the air force said, with media reporting that one of the pilots was killed.

entries.title: 1 Dead, 24 Injured In Mass Shooting In US, Probe Launched: Report
entries.description: At least one person was killed and at least 24 others injured in a mass shooting in the US state of Ohio early on Sunday, reports said.

entries.title: Maldives To Ban Israelis To Protest Against War In Gaza
entries.description: The Indian Ocean nation of the Maldives will ban Israelis from the luxury tourist hot spot, the office of the president said Sunday, announcing a national rally in "solidarity with Palestine".

entries.title: Donald Trump Warns Jail Time Could Be "Breaking Point" For His Supporters
entries.description: Donald Trump has warned that sending him to prison could prove a "breaking point" for his supporters - remarks that will fuel concerns of political violence around the US presidential election on November 5.

entries.title: "He Should Be...": Adult Star Breaks Silence On Donald Trump's Conviction
entries.description: Stormy Daniels, the adult film actor, broke her silence after former US president Donald Trump's conviction to say he should be jailed, in an interview published in British tabloid The Mirror at the weekend.

entries.title: Media Mogul Rupert Murdoch Marries For Fifth Time At Age Of 93
entries.description: Media magnate Rupert Murdoch has married for the fifth time at age 93, tying the knot with a retired molecular biologist a quarter century younger than him.

entries.title: Planetary Parade On June 3? Here's What It Will Really Look Like
entries.description: Experts from NASA and Astronomers Without Borders said that June 3 is not the best time to see the planetary parade.

entries.title: Businesswoman Halla Tomasdottir Becomes Iceland's New President
entries.description: Businesswoman Halla Tomasdottir was on Sunday declared the winner of Iceland's presidential election, final results showed, beating former prime minister Katrin Jakobsdottir whom critics said was too political for the post.

entries.title: "It's Tougher On My Family Than It's On Me": Donald Trump On Criminal Trial
entries.description: Donald Trump says his historic criminal trial was "very hard" on his wife Melania, a notable absentee from the close family members who attended court in support of the former president.

entries.title: Donald Trump Joins TikTok, A Platform He Once Sought To Ban In US
entries.description: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump has joined TikTok, the short video social media platform that is owned by China-based tech giant ByteDance and that he tried to ban as president, ahead of the US elections in November.

entries.title: California's Clear Lake Turns Green With Algae, Visible From Space: NASA
entries.description: Clear Lake, a popular hub for fishing, water sports, and recreation, stretches over 68 square miles in Northern California.

entries.title: 6 Indian Tourists Injured As Jeep Overturns Near Lake In Nepal's Chitwan
entries.description: Six Indian tourists, mostly senior citizens, were injured when the jeep they were travelling in overturned near a lake in Nepal's Chitwan district on Sunday, officials said.

entries.title: "Warm Seats, Precision Spray": Japan's High-Tech Toilets Go Global
entries.description: As Japan plays host to a record influx of tourists, one of the country's more private attractions -- the high-tech toilet -- is becoming a must-have in luxury bathrooms worldwide.

entries.title: MrBeast Overtakes T-Series To Become Most Subscribed YouTuber
entries.description: Jimmy Donaldson, aka MrBeast, has now become the most subscribed YouTuber. His channel has surpassed the music company T-Series on the video-sharing platform.

entries.title: After 12 Years, Ahmadinejad Set To Contest Iran Presidential Polls Again
entries.description: Iran's hardline former President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad has registered to run for president in the country's June 28 election, organized after the death of Ebrahim Raisi in a helicopter crash last month, Iran's state television reported on Sunday.

entries.title: Princess Diana's Personal Letters To Her Former Housekeeper To Be Auctioned
entries.description: The collection includes correspondence authored by Diana after her 1981 marriage to then-Prince Charles, as well as 14 Christmas and New Year cards sent between 1981 and 1995.

entries.title: ChatGPT Was Asked For Legal Advice - 5 Reasons Why It Was A Bad Idea
entries.description: A survey carried out in 2023 by the Law Society, the Legal Services Board and YouGov found that two-thirds of respondents had experienced a legal issue in the past four years.

entries.title: Japan Loses Contact With Humanity's Only Active Venus Probe 'Akatsuki'
entries.description: Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA) has confirmed that it lost contact with the spacecraft Akatsuki, humanity's only mission to Venus. The announcement was made on X (formerly Twitter).

entries.title: Robert De Niro Stripped Of Leadership Award After Calling Trump A "Clown"
entries.description: The 80-year-old Oscar-winner was set to receive the National Association of Broadcasters' Service to America Award next Tuesday.

entries.title: Actor Chris Evans Clarifies He Did Not Sign Israeli Bomb As Pic Goes Viral
entries.description: Hollywood star Chris Evans, better known as Captain America, has finally broken his silence on the controversy surrounding an old picture of him signing what initially appeared to be an Israeli bomb.
